The future got a little brighter at the Fox Theatre on Thursday. 
The iconic Detroit venue's rebuilt marquee, including two new digital screens and nearly a mile of neon lighting, came to life during a Thursday afternoon ceremony held for Olympia Entertainment staff. Fox owners Mike and Marian Ilitch watched from a nearby car as the relighting event was led by Ilitch Holdings chief Chris Ilitch and OIympia president Tom Wilson. 
The event capped a months-long project that replaced nearly every piece of the 87-year-old theater's marquee, including handcrafted "F-O-X" lettering created by glassblowing artisans.
